page.title: 16Harvest around Holbeach Bank
page.content: In Autumn the farmer sows the seeds. In the Winter the wheat and barley do not grow but when Spring comes it grows again. The farmers in Holbeach Bank cut the wheat in August. The stalks of wheat that are left are made into bales of straw. The stubble that is left in the ground is burnt. The ground is now ready to be ploughed so they can sow the seed again. Also at harvest time they gather the peas.The pea viner is a machine which collects the peas and then shells them. Then they are washed twice and poured into a trailer to be taken to a factory in Kings Lynn and frozen. This takes less than two hours. The pea viners work all day and night. Potatoes are harvested in October. Sugar beet is lifted between September and January and taken to the sugar beet factory in Spalding.
